verbose_text: Moreover, our data show that SSB intake in the top quintile of SSB consumers from each of the NHANES 1999-2004 study periods has begun to decline (7.2 SSB serving equivalents per day in 1999-2000, to 7.1 SSB serving equivalents per day in 2001-2002, to 6.9 SSB serving equivalents per day in 2003-2004) after increasing dramatically from the amount of SSB consumption in NHANES III (6.5 SSB serving equivalents per day in 1988-1991, and 6.7 SSB serving equivalents per day in 1991-1994).
